description.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must offer schools a holistic, relationship-focused way to address conflict and build opportunities for students to improve all children’s chances for success.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

richText.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-3","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The school-to-prison pipeline has become a front door into the criminal-legal system. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"This pipeline is characterized by punitive and exclusionary policies and practices that push students out of school and into the criminal-legal system. School-based officers arrest students on site, put them in chokeholds, and handcuff children as young as six years old. Typical adolescent behavior has become criminalized in school, especially for students of color. For instance, Black students are expelled at three times the rate of White students. Students who are suspended or dispelled for discretionary violations are nearly three times as likely to be involved in the criminal-legal system the following year. This approach funnels youth into jails and prisons and denies them the very opportunities for learning and growth that schools are meant to provide.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The school-to-prison pipeline must end. We must advocate against school-based officers and out-of-school suspensions. But that is not enough. The real solution must go beyond these reactive measures; it must also offer schools a holistic, relationship-focused way to address conflicts that occur and build additional opportunities for students to grow and thrive. Providing these supports will not only end the school-to-prison pipeline but will also create a school-to-opportunity pipeline that improves all children’s chances for success.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

content.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Black students are expelled at three times the rate of White students. Students that are suspended or dispelled for discretionary violations are nearly three times as likely to be involved in the criminal legal system the following year. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"End the school-to-prison pipeline by advocating against school-based police officers and out-of-school suspensions, and instead fund counselors and implement trauma-informed care within school systems. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"heading-4","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Adequately fund and implement robust restorative justice practices in schools. ","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"paragraph","content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}],"data":{}}]}

text.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"We must repair the enormous damage that policies from the War on Drugs have caused, while reinvesting all savings into communities.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

promo2.title: Invest in people and communities first

text.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We must invest our resources in community-based supports that prioritize true public safety and help communities thrive.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}
